summary: VA provides care to about 9,000 veterans in 134 VA-operated nursing homes, called "community living centers." For oversight, VA conducts unannounced inspections and tracks quality measures (such as the percentage of residents with a fall) and nurse staffing levels. Performance generally improved from FY 2015-FY 2019. For example, inspections found fewer practices that caused actual harm. But deficiencies didn't consistently trend downward and individual centers...
title: VA Community Living Centers: Opportunities Exist to Strengthen Oversight of Quality of Care
